intro: Gastrochilus changjiangensis, commonly known as the Changjiang gastrochilus, is a rare orchid species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), adapting to its moist, shaded habitat. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
